intro: Cinnagrostis trichodonta, commonly known as the hairy leaf cinnagrostis, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has distinctive hairy leaves that aid in water retention. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cinnagrostis trichodonta is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and aesthetic value.
